result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Gabriel John Aguad-Baumgartner was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Gabriel John Aguad-Baumgartner in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: wcs WORKER TERRELL H. 

AS TO COUNT ONE:   
Court orders defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services forthwith for a period 45 DAYS CONCURRENT TO COUNT TWO  with 45 days credit time served in accordance with the conditional release plan. 

As to Count TWO:
 
Court orders defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services forthwith for a period of 45 days concurrent to Count ONE with 45 days credit time served in accordance with the conditional release plan. 

As to Count THREE:  

Court orders defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services forthwith for a period  of Six months with 0 days credit time served in accordance with the conditional release plan.

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.
Confidential Forensic

Attorney Dudley A. Williams in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   ON motion of the Defense, Court will allow defendant to travel to Florida to care for and be with his mother who is terminally ill and in hospice care. Court vacates the 7-19-16 date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

PHASE II on mental responisbility proceeded.  Sworn in thr the defense:  Dr. Rawski.  Defense rests. State rests.  Testimony closed.  Cause argued.  Court found defendant was NOT mentallyresponsible for his actions at the time of the offense.  The Court found the defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease /defect on 4014016 .  Parties review the report prepared by Dr. Rawski date 1/20/16.  The Court determined that the defendatn suffers from a mental illness.  The Court finds that the defenant is not a danger to himself or the community.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in branch 47.

AS TO ALL THREE COUNTS: 

Defendant waived rights and pled no contest as to all three Counts.  No contest  Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a no contest  plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

COURT ORDERED BAIL TRANSFERRED TO CASE 15CM2203.   Defendant release without bail on this case.
